analyzed: g-yas pas mchog sbyin pa /
translated: With her right hand she makes the boon-granting gesture.

original: mdzes pa'i phreng ba dang na bza' mnabs pa /

translated: holding a blue utpala flower in the left hand, wearing white garments, seated on a lotus seat, one should meditate on him in the three times.

analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad las sgrol zhing bcings pa rnams grol bar byed de /
translated: He liberates from all suffering and frees those who are bound.

analyzed: lcags sgrog gis bsdams pa dang / zhags pas bcings pa dang / gdon gyis rengs pa las sgrol bar byed do //
translated: He liberates from being bound by iron fetters, bound by a noose, and paralyzed by a spirit.

original: bcings pa'i gnas su bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: bcings pa'i gnas su bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite in a place of bondage.

original: stong ngam brgyad brgya nyi ma re re la bzlas pas grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong ngam brgyad brgya nyi ma re re la bzlas pas grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites one thousand or eight hundred times each day, one will be freed.

original: gal te mi grol na de'i tshe mgo 'gas shing bcad par 'gyur bas bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mi grol na de'i tshe mgo 'gas shing bcad par 'gyur bas bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is not freed, then at that time one's head will split and be cut off, so one will be happy.

original: che ge mo grol bar gyis shig / gal te ma grol na de'i tshe mgo 'gas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: che ge mo grol bar gyis shig / gal te ma grol na de'i tshe mgo 'gas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Liberate so-and-so! If one is not freed, then at that time one's head will split.

original: rims chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rims chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: One will have a great fever.

original: mi bzad pa'i zug rngu chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi bzad pa'i zug rngu chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: One will have a great unbearable pain.

original: sgrub pa po mthong bas ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa po mthong bas ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The adept will be given by the sight of her.

original: nyi ma bdun gyis nges par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma bdun gyis nges par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In seven days, he will certainly be liberated.

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das ngan song las sgrol ba'i sgrol mas gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das ngan song las sgrol ba'i sgrol mas gsungs so //
translated: This was taught by the Blessed One, the Liberator from Evil Destinies.

original: h'um hr'im dza:lan bdun du me tog la mngon par bsngags nas sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: h'um hr'im dza:lan bdun du me tog la mngon par bsngags nas sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Recite hum hriṃ jaḥ seven times over a flower and give it to the disciple.

translated: In the middle of the offering, [recite] khaṃ.🔽Recite bhrūṃ āṃ jriṃ hūṃ counterclockwise.

original: g-yas skor gyis l'am m'am p'am p'am t'am zhes so //
analyzed: g-yas skor gyis l'am m'am p'am p'am t'am zhes so //
translated: Recite laṃ maṃ paṃ phaṃ taṃ clockwise.

original: ngan song las sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /

translated: The sādhana of the Liberator from Evil Destinies is complete.
